tutorial.select-label-type-1: In this Street View image, we have drawn an arrow to a curb ramp. Let’s label it. Click the flashing "Curb Ramp" button above.
tutorial.label-attribute-1: Good! Now click the curb ramp beneath the flashing yellow arrow to label it.
tutorial.rate-severity-1: Now you can rate the quality of the curb ramp where 1 is passable and 5 is not passable for a wheelchair user. Because it is wide enough and has a friction strip, let’s rate it as 1, passable.
tutorial.redo-rate-attribute-1: Uh-oh, you should rate this curb ramp as 1, passable. It is a high quality curb ramp that is wide enough and has a friction strip. Let’s click "1" to set its quality.
tutorial.adjust-heading-angle-1: Great! Let’s adjust the view to look at another corner of the intersection. Grab and drag the Street View image to look left.
tutorial.zoom-in: Hmm, it looks like the intersection corner is too far away to see clearly. Click the “Zoom In” button to get a closer look.
tutorial.select-label-type-2: Great! Now you’ve found another curb ramp. Let’s label it! Click the “Curb Ramp” button like before.
tutorial.rate-severity-2: Good, now rate the quality of the curb ramp.
tutorial.redo-rate-attribute-2: Uh-oh, you should rate this curb ramp as 2, somewhat passable. It is a high quality curb ramp but it has no landing space at the top of the ramp for making turns. Let’s click "2" to set its quality.
tutorial.tag-attribute-2: Every label includes optional tags that add descriptive information. Choose appropriate tags for every label you place! Let's add the “not enough landing space” tag because there is not enough space for a wheelchair user to turn when they get to the top of the ramp.
tutorial.redo-tag-attribute-2: Only the "not enough landing space" tag applies here, since the curb ramp has a friction strip, is not too narrow nor steep, and does not point into traffic. So add only the "not enough landing space" tag.
tutorial.select-label-type-3: Notice that there is no curb ramp at the end of this crosswalk. Click the "Missing Curb Ramp" button to label it.
tutorial.label-attribute-3: Now click beneath the flashing yellow arrow to label the missing curb ramp.
tutorial.rate-severity-3: Since this missing curb ramp is next to an existing curb ramp, this accessibility problem is less severe. So let’s rate it as a 3. When you rate accessibility, we just ask that you use your best judgment!
tutorial.redo-rate-attribute-3: Hmm, since this missing curb ramp is next to an existing curb ramp, this accessibility problem is less severe. Let’s click "3" to change the severity of the missing curb ramp.
tutorial.tag-attribute-3: Let's add the "alternate route present" tag because there is a nearby curb ramp that could be used.
tutorial.redo-tag-attribute-3: The "alternate route present" tag is the only tag that applies here because there is a nearby curb ramp that could be used. So add only the "alternate route present" tag.
tutorial.zoom-out: Now let’s zoom out and look at the next intersection corner. Click the “Zoom Out” button.
tutorial.adjust-heading-angle-2: Look to the left by grabbing and dragging the Street View image.
tutorial.select-label-type-4: OK, this corner has two curb ramps. Let’s label them both! Click the "Curb Ramp" button.
tutorial.label-both-curbs: Now click on one of the curb ramps to label it.
tutorial.select-label-type-6: Notice that the sidewalk suddenly ends here. Let’s label this. Click the "No Sidewalk" button to label it.
tutorial.label-attribute-6: Click on the ground where the sidewalk is missing.
tutorial.rate-severity-6: Since there is a sidewalk on the other side of the street, this accessibility problem is less severe. So let’s rate it as a 3.
tutorial.redo-rate-attribute-6: Hmm, since there is a sidewalk on the other side of the street, this accessibility problem is less severe. Let’s click "3" to change the severity of the no sidewalk label.
tutorial.tag-attribute-6: Let's add the "ends abruptly" and "street has a sidewalk" tags because there is a sidewalk on the other side of the street.
tutorial.redo-tag-attribute-6: The "ends abruptly" and "street has a sidewalk" tags are the only tags that apply here. So make sure to add only those two tags.
tutorial.adjust-heading-angle-4: Awesome! Let’s finish labeling the last curb ramp in the intersection. First, grab and drag the Street View image.
tutorial.select-label-type-7: Good! Now click the "Curb Ramp" button on the menu to label it.
tutorial.label-attribute-7: Click the curb ramp beneath the flashing yellow arrow to label it.
tutorial.adjust-heading-angle-5: Great Job! We are almost done. Now let’s learn how to move. Grab and drag the Street View image.
tutorial.walk-1: Good! Now to figure out where to go next, you will follow the red line on this mini map.
tutorial.walk-2: We will also guide you via navigation messages shown in this area. You can click on them to turn or move.
tutorial.walk-3: Now let's actually move forward! You can click on the navigation message, or you can click on the arrow that points in the direction you want to move.
tutorial.walk-4: Great! You just moved down the street. Visited parts of a route are marked in green in the mini map.
tutorial.walk-5-1: Now you can look for more issues at this location. In this case, notice how there is a crosswalk with no curb ramps.
tutorial.walk-5-2: Yes! I see the missing curb ramps.
tutorial.walk-6-1: Ordinarily, you would label the areas under the flashing arrows with a Missing Curb Ramp
tutorial.walk-6-2: However, we want to get you started on actual missions, so let’s finish this tutorial!
tutorial.instruction-1: You can track your labels in the mini map!
tutorial.instruction-2: Finally, if you get stuck while exploring, you can use the Stuck button to move to a different location.

common.label-too-far: Oops! Your label is too far away. Let's remove the misplaced label. Hover over the label and click the delete icon
common.re-label: Good! Now, let's label again. Click the "{{label_type}}" button from above.
common.label-curb-ramp: Now click the curb ramp beneath the flashing yellow arrow to label it.
common.rate-severity-curb-ramp: Let’s rate the quality of the curb ramp.
common.redo-rate-curb-ramp-severity-1: Hmm, you should rate this curb ramp as 1, passable. This curb ramp is wide enough, has a friction strip, and doesn't point into traffic. Let’s click "1" to change its rating.
common.rate-severity-4: Now rate the curb ramp’s quality. Use your best judgment. You can also write notes in the Description Box.
common.select-label-type-second-curb-ramp: Click the "Curb Ramp" button to label the other curb ramp now.

mission-start.title: Explore __DISTANCE_PLACEHOLDER__ in __NEIGHBORHOOD_PLACEHOLDER__
mission-start.title-continue: Continue exploring __DISTANCE_PLACEHOLDER__ in __NEIGHBORHOOD_PLACEHOLDER__ for accessibility features!
mission-start.body-first: Your first mission is to explore __DISTANCE_PLACEHOLDER__ in __NEIGHBORHOOD_PLACEHOLDER__ and find all the accessibility features that affect mobility impaired travelers!
mission-start.body: Your mission is to explore __DISTANCE_PLACEHOLDER__ in __NEIGHBORHOOD_PLACEHOLDER__ and find all the accessibility features that affect mobility impaired travelers!

instruction.walk: Explore the streets and find all the accessibility attributes
instruction.curb-ramp: Locate and label a curb ramp
instruction.no-curb-ramp: Locate and label a missing curb ramp
instruction.obstacle: Locate and label an obstacle in path
instruction.surface-problem: Locate and label a surface problem
instruction.occlusion: Label a part of sidewalk that cannot be observed
instruction.signal: Locate and label a pedestrian signal

current-mission.message-first-mission: Explore for __PLACEHOLDER__ and find all the sidewalk accessibility attributes

context-menu.severity: Please click to label a severity

compass.unlabeled-problems: Do you see any unlabeled problems? If not,
compass.end-of-route:
You have reached the end of this route. Finish labeling this intersection then
click here to move to a new location.
compass.far-away:
Uh-oh, you're quite far away from the route.
Click here to jump back.

popup.start-body: We have moved you to a street in {{neighborhood}}, {{city}}! You are currently standing at the intersection. Please find and label all the curb ramps and accessibility problems at this intersection.
popup.step-body: It looks like you've looked around this entire intersection, so it's time to explore other areas. Move in the direction of the red line highlighted on the map.
popup.both-sides-title: Please check both sides of the street
popup.both-sides-body: As you explore, remember to check both sides of the street like this:
popup.labels-disappear-body: Wondering where your labels went? After you move, you won't see them in the Street View image anymore, but you can still see them on the highlighted mini map!
popup.jump: You have been moved to a new location.
popup.jump-auto: We have automatically moved you to a new location.
popup.signup-body: Do you want to create an account to keep track of your progress?
popup.signup-button-signin: I do have an account! Let me sign in.
popup.severity-shortcuts: Please provide severity ratings for each label by pressing keys <kbd>1</kbd> through <kbd>5</kbd>
popup.zoom-shortcuts: You can also press the <kbd>Z</kbd> key to zoom in and the <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>Z</kbd> keys to zoom out.
popup.label-shortcuts-curb-ramp: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Curb Ramp label.
popup.label-shortcuts-no-curb-ramp: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Missing Curb Ramp label.
popup.label-shortcuts-obstacle: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Obstacle label.
popup.label-shortcuts-surface-problem: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Surface Problem label.
popup.label-shortcuts-no-sidewalk: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the No Sidewalk label.
popup.label-shortcuts-crosswalk: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Crosswalk label.
popup.label-shortcuts-signal: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Pedestrian Signal label.
popup.label-shortcuts-occlusion: You can also press the <kbd>{{key}}</kbd> key for selecting the Can't See the Sidewalk label.
popup.still-stuck: If you're still stuck, click the Stuck button again.
popup.stuck-skipped-street: We couldn't find a spot for you on that street, so we moved you to a new street.
popup.stuck-suggestion: If you can't move with the arrows, trying clicking on the navigation directions in the bottom right. Or try clicking on the Stuck button on the left.
